meanings.definition: To convert or be converted into vapor.
meanings.sent1: The warm sun volatilises the water in the puddle.
meanings.sent2: The alcohol volatilises quickly when exposed to air.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made the water in the glass volatilise into thin air!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter volatilises the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The heat of the fire volatilises the ice, turning it into steam.

meanings.sent1: The spilled milk volatilises in the hot sun.

meanings.sent3: The chef's secret sauce seemed to volatilise into thin air!
meanings.sent4: His dreams seemed to volatilise before his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The mist volatilises as the sun rises, disappearing into the sky.

meanings.sent1: The situation volatilises when tempers flare.
meanings.sent2: Emotions can volatilise quickly in a heated argument.
meanings.sent3: The gossip seemed to volatilise through the office.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room volatilises, creating an uneasy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The uncertainty in the air seemed to volatilise, leaving everyone on edge.
